title: World Cup 2022: France thumps Australia 4-1 to launch World Cup defense
description: Olivier Giroud scored twice as World Cup holders France recovered from the shock of going behind to thump Australia 4-1 in their opener in Qatar on Tuesday, November 22.

title: In China, youth frustration over zero-Covid policy is taking a political turn
description: Young people feel robbed of their youth by an increasingly autocratic power, to the point of daring to criticize the regime more openly.

title: Indonesian earthquake: More than 250 dead and thousands displaced amongst widespread destruction
description: The earthquake took place on the island of Java, 100 kilometers from Jakarta, in the mountainous region of Cianjur.

title: Hungary's Orban under pressure over 'revisionist' map scarf
description: At a football game, the prime minister wore a scarf that depicted historical Hungary, including parts of Ukraine and neighboring countries.

title: World Cup 2022: Why Belgium's second jersey was rejected
description: The Red Devils were asked to hide the word 'Love' on their second team shirt, but not for reasons relating to FIFA's rejection of the One Love anti-discrimination armbands.

title: Migrant boat docks in Crete after dramatic rescue
description: The ship, holding some 500 migrants, faced gale-force winds over 30 kilometers an hour.

title: France in shock over murder of tax inspector during routine audit
description: A French tax inspector was killed during an audit at the home of a dealer in second-hand goods, police say.

title: World Cup 2022: Sporting the armband of discord
description: Seven European teams claimed they should be allowed to wear the 'One Love' armbands against discrimination during the competition, but FIFA refused to permit them.

title: International community rallies around Moldova in the face of Russian threat
description: France has announced an aid package of €100 million for the vulnerable former Soviet republic, whose security is considered crucial in the context of the war in Ukraine.

title: 'My first feminist protest was a liberating moment, I felt badass'
description: On the occasion of a major 'Nous Toutes' demonstration across France on November 19, 20-year-old Pauline talks about the intense emotion she felt during her first demonstration, which was decisive in her commitment.

title: Colombia opens negotiations with National Liberation Army guerrillas
description: The National Liberation Army still has 2,500 fighters on the ground.

title: Social security budget: French PM bypasses Assemblée Nationale for the fifth time
description: The move was criticized by both right and left groups, who denounced 'an umpteenth forced passage.'

title: A French start-up offers cheap movie tickets to fill theaters
description: Ozzak has already signed with 23 cinemas, including Le Grand Rex in Paris, and is targeting a casual cinema-going clientele.

title: The Swedish right and far right seek to create a cultural canon
description: After Sweden's September 11 elections, the new majority wants to draw up lists of classics in several cultural domains, similar to what Danes did in 2006.

title: World Cup 2022: Saudi Arabia stuns with victory over Argentina
description: Argentina's shock 2-1 World Cup defeat to Saudi Arabia hurt badly as the Copa America champions' long unbeaten run came to a shuddering halt.

title: World Cup 2022: Iranian fans divided over support for their team
description: In their first game of the competition, Iranian players chose not to sing their national anthem in a show of support for protesters at home, to a mixed reaction from the stands.

title: China's Guangzhou goes into lockdown to stop major Covid-19 outbreak
description: Beijing also announced new Covid restrictions for anyone arriving in the city.

title: The role of charity in the face of cuts to England's NHS
description: 'The English malaise' (2/6). In this series, 'Le Monde' examines the deepening crisis that England is enduring, marked by political instability and a deteriorating social climate. Part two discovers that the celebrated NHS would have trouble surviving without the help of charities.

title: Iran says it enriches uranium to 60% purity at Fordo site
description: Iran has begun producing its production at the Fordo nuclear plant, official media reported Tuesday, describing it as a response to a resolution by the United Nations' nuclear watchdog.

title: Mali junta bans activities of NGOs funded by France
description: The Malian government's move comes in response to France's recent decision to halt development aid.

title: New nose successfully grown on French woman's arm
description: Surgeons in France successfully grew a nose on a 50-year-old woman's arm and transplanted it onto her face. She had lost a large portion of her original nose during cancer treatment.

title: Luigi Di Maio's possible appointment to the European diplomatic service is creating waves
description: The former leader of the Euroskeptic anti-establishment Five Star Movement party is being considered to represent the European Union in the Gulf. Josep Borrell has yet to validate this choice.

title: With three heat waves, the summer of 2022 was the deadliest in France since 2003
description: France recorded an excess of more than 2,800 deaths during the heat waves, according to new data.

title: 'Adapting the existing': Paris' plan to reach 40% affordable housing by 2035
description: The French capital is planning on converting offices, empty schools, and garages into social and affordable homes to meet this goal.

title: Cross-Channel migration: An impossible status quo
description: The tragedy of November 24, 2021, in which 27 migrants drowned in the English Channel, demonstrates the need for the UK to play its part in the rescue and reception of asylum seekers.

title: Indonesia earthquake death toll rises to over 250
description: Rescuers searching for survivors under the rubble of buildings on Java island have discovered dozens of bodies, making the official death toll jump dramatically.

title: With the World Cup in Qatar, football is undergoing a new test of its endurance
description: Football has already had to overcome hardships during its history and it has also had to manage the economic transformation of its model. The World Cup in Qatar represents another challenge, as controversies around the event have multiplied.

title: IMF tells France to end its 'whatever it takes' policy
description: The Washington-based institution is urging France to funnel aid towards the least well-off in the face of the energy crisis and to accelerate public spending cuts.

title: Greece rescuing hundreds on drifting boat off Crete
description: A fishing boat with up to 500 migrants onboard off the coast of Crete made an emergency call to Greek authorites Monday night.

title: In Portugal, the energy crisis is putting livelihoods at stake
description: With more than two-thirds of Portugal's homes failing to meet minimum thermal insulation standards, many households will not be able to keep warm this winter.

title: French government cuts length of unemployment insurance by 25%
description: Minister of Labor Olivier Dussopt at a press conference described 'difficulties recruiting new employees' that 'justifies a downward adjustment of the maximum duration of compensation.'

title: The Louvre Abu Dhabi celebrates its 5th anniversary and hopes for many more
description: The commemoration of the cultural institution designed by Jean Nouvel elicits the ambiguity and tension in the marriage between France and the emirates.

title: Who is the world's worst boss?
description: Despite stiff competition, Peter Hebblethwaite, the head of P&O was awarded the prize of shame by the International Trade Union Confederation.

title: Death of 27 migrants crossing the Channel: Investigators consider criminal charges for French rescuers
description: The French police investigating the sinking of a migrant boat that left 27 people dead in November 2021, question the behavior of CROSS (Regional Operating Surveillance and Rescue Centers) who refused to send a rescue ship, despite urgent requests by the British coastguards.

title: World Cups: France has seen it all – heaven and hell
description: France has gone from being the favorite for the 2022 World Cup in Qatar to a team in crisis. Can 'Les Bleus', who play their first game on Tuesday, escape the customary reigning champion slump?

title: 38 dead in factory fire in central China
description: China has a history of industrial accidents caused by lax regard to safety measures fueled by rising competition and abetted by corruption among officials.

title: World Cup 2022: US settles for draw after Bale penalty
description: After a first half dominated by the US, Welsh start Garreth Bale scored an 82nd-minute penalty to break American hearts.
